alert.note: Alert for Laramie (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 27 at 10:36PM MDT until July 27 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Kimball County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southwestern Banner County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... East central Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 1130 PM MDT. * At 1035 PM MDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 12 miles southeast of La Grange to near Albin, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Oliver Reservoir, Oliver Campground and Bushnell. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 3 and 17. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately.Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
